answers.answer: hey girl, long time no talk. was this result after the 1-hour test or the 3-hour test? Borderline isn't too bad it probably doesn't require anything more than a slight diet change. I've never had it before, but my cousin had it with both pregnancies. I know that fast weight gain isn't always the only cause...sometimes your body just loses the ability to handle certain things with successive pregnancies and since this is your second (I think I'm remembering right?) you may just have developed it out of hand. Hang in there hon...do you have to get another test or are they just recommending a change in your diet and monitoring?

I have had gestational diabetes with all of my boy pregnancies. I have always been able to diet control mine. Just read the label on and make sure that you are getting enough protein. What has your dr told you and what is he recommending? I can share more with you if I have more info.

Thanks ladies!That result was from the 1 hour test, my doc. wants me to come in for the 3 hour now.I know a few ladies that have G.D. and all of them are on insulin! I want to have this baby v-bac  so bad and Im so scared that I am going to have to have another csection.....This is my 3rd pregnancy and 2 second child. My last preg ended at about 7 weeks.My doc. didnt even give me much info, all he said was that I have to go in for this test soon. I guess I will find out more at my app. later in the week!Thanks again!

Another Q...I swelled in my hands and feet really bad with my first DS and lately with this pregnancy I have been swelling again. I didnt swell this soon with DS.Anyway my Q is: My left foot, ankle, and calf is ALWAYS a little swollen and more so then my right, should I be concerned?

Were you doing the 1 hr or 3 hr glucose?  I have failed the 1 hr with my past FOUR pregnancies.  My 3 hr glucose has always come back as normal except this last time.  I was told I was borderline on the 3 hr.  Doc said to watch my sugar intake.  I was fine, I did,not develop GD or have any other problems.  I too started out most of my pregnancies overweight.  I wouldn't worry, chances are good your 3 hr will come back fine.As for swelling.  I have problems with swelling and vericose veins and even collapsed surface veins mostly in my right leg. I asked my doc is it is possible that my uterus is tipped more to the right creating more pressure on that side and he said it's very like the culprit.  Mention the swelling to your doctor so he is aware of it but I don't think it's anythign to worry about.  I'm 23 weeks today and the last several days I've been swelling like crazy.

Thanks LosingMyMind!It was my 1 hour test. I dont really have anyone to talk to here in the area about it. My SIL is a know it all and would be telling me I have to go to the ER and everyone else I know it 'less' educated about pregnancy then me! :)Thanks again!

I was borderline with my last pregnancy and was JUST fine. I still ate whatever, and I never had any problems. Have you had your BP checked lately? With all of your swelling, I would be worried about pre-eclampsia, especially when it presents at 24 weeks and after. You could just be retaining a whole lot of water. Start drinking lots and lots of water! But no reason to cry hun. I know it's upsetting but seriously I was JUST fine!! =)

question: Hey ladies hope everyone is feeling well!Yesterday I went in for my gestational diabetes test, my doc. sent me in early because I am measuring a little big.Well I got the phone call this morning and I am boarder line! Im so upset, I spent the night in the ER with my son because he said he had swallowed a battery and then I get this call!? (He didnt eat a battery, he has been telling a lot of stories lately)  And to top it all off Im a swollen like a balloon! Its driving me crazy!!!I have been reading about it all morning and Im a little confused, I am over weight even before the pregnancy but I have only gained 5-6 lbs and I am 23 weeks. The only thing I cant think of is that I have been eating a lot of home baked goods (cookies and treats) but that is it. I really dont have anything else they list for being at risk. It said that if you gain to much weight to fast that can cause it among other things....I guess I'll deal with it but I have been fighting tears all morning!Anyone else have gestational diabetes or had it before??
title: Im so upset! Gestational Diabetes???
